description: From Norman ormèr/ormer, variants of French ormier, contraction of oreille-de-mer, from Late Latin *auris maris (“ear of the sea”), from Latin auris (“ear”) + mare (“sea”).

entries.meaning: An abalone or sea-ear, particularly Haliotis tuberculata, common in the Channel Islands.
examples: The food I like best of all foods is ormers; but you can't always get them.
